Contradict fact: The claim made by President Trump that the United States has tested more than every country combined is contradicted by the expert's verdict, which states that three countries alone (Russia, Germany, and Italy) have done more combined testing than the U.S.
Understate: The claim made by President Trump understates the testing efforts of other countries by stating that the U.S. has tested more than every country combined, which is not accurate.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is not backed by evidence or data to prove that the U.S. has tested more than every country combined.
Problematic assumption: The claim made by President Trump assumes that the U.S. has tested more than every country combined without considering the testing efforts of other countries. This assumption is problematic as it is not supported by the available data.
